action: Chosen opponent loses 1 lore. Gain 1 lore.
flavour: Apples, gems, magic lamp . . . Abu's not picky as long as there's something worth stealing.

name: Lead the Way
action: Your characters get +2 ※ this turn.
flavour: “We have what it takes to find our way through this maze, together! Hold on—we're going in!”

name: The Islands I Pulled From The Sea
action:
(A character with cost 3 or more can ↷ sing this song for free.)
Search your deck for a location card, reveal that card to all players, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Energy Blast
action: Banish chosen character. Draw a card.
flavour:
"Did you really think I would fight fair?" 
-Jafar

name: Longboat

–Vanellope von Schweetz

action: <mark>A SUITABLE WEAPON</mark> Your damaged characters get +1 ※.

action: <mark>FAVORABLE CHANCE</mark> During your turn, whenever a card is put into your inkwell, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it’s an item card, you may play that item for free and it enters play exerted. Otherwise, put it on the bottom of your deck.

name: Yokai
title: Enigmatic Inventor

title: Scientific Expert
action: <mark>REPORTING FOR DUTY</mark> When you play this character, put chosen character of yours into your inkwell facedown and exerted.

title: Robotics Prodigy
action: <mark>SWEET TECH</mark>  ↷, 2 ⬡ − Search your deck for an item card or a Robot character card and reveal it to all players. Shuffle your deck and put that card on top of it.

title: Not-So-Tricky Chicken

EAT ANYTHING When you play this character, exert chosen opposing item. It can’t ready at the start of its next turn.

name: Gadget Hackwrench
title: Perceptive Mouse
flavour: All the clues pointed to an island, but I never thought I'd see it on a map. Golly, this is incredible! I mean, the island actually exists, so it's technically credible—but still! This is amazing!

name: Dr. Delbert Doppler
title: Fussy Astronomer
flavour: “Of course! It all makes perfect sense. That’s why my old star charts are useless. Every star in the sky here is different!”

name: Tadashi Hamada
title: Baymax Inventor

name: Hiro Hamada
